text.section:
The Kentucky Emergency Operations Plan and local emergency operations plans shall include measures for, and the Governor for the state or portion thereof, the county judge/executive for a county other than an urban-county, or a portion thereof, and the mayor for a city or an urban-county or portion thereof, may issue written executive orders providing for:
The control of traffic in order to provide for rapid and safe movement in evacuation over public highways and streets during any disaster or emergency;
The control and alteration of speed limits and traffic regulations on public highways during any disaster or emergency; and
The prohibition or limitation of use of motor vehicles on public highways during any disaster or emergency.
The Governor may extend the provisions of subsection (1) of this section to the public thoroughfares of any political subdivision of the Commonwealth.
The Governor may order agencies of state government and political subdivisions of the Commonwealth to take steps necessary to effectuate plans made or orders issued pursuant to this section.
During a declared emergency or disaster, the Governor, county judge/executive, or mayor, may, for their respective jurisdictions, place these plans in effect.

law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 226, sec. 14, effective July 15, 1998.
